body:
Overview

In HackerRank for Work, while creating a question you can support the problem statement by attaching a relevant file. Within the Problem Description section of the Question, you can provide the link to a file or upload it as an attachment. While taking the test, your candidates can access and view the attached file from the question description area.

Adding Files to Problem Description

1. In the Problem Description area of a question, click on the Link option, as shown below. 

Option to Upload a File

2. The Add Link dialog box displays. In the Text Display field, specify the text you want to display as a link to access the file.

3. Click on the Upload a document option, and choose the file to upload. The URL field automatically populates the file access link.

Uploading a File

 4. Click on the OK button. The specified text displays as a link to access the file.

File upload link added to the Problem Statement

Similarly, while defining a multiple choice type question, you can attach a file access link to every answer choice.

5. Click on the edit as a rich text link. Define the answer, and click on the Link option in the editor to add a file access link. Upload a file, and the file access link displays next to the answer choice.

File Uploaded as a Link in an MCQ Answer Choice

6. Click on the Save Question button.

7. When candidates view the question in a test, the link to access the file is available in the question as shown below.

Link to Access a File in MCQ Answer

Attaching a File to Interviewer Guidelines

You can also include a file access link as part of the Question’s Interviewer Guidelines as shown below.

File upload link added to the internal notes

Removing a Link or File Attachment

To remove a file access link, select the link in the appropriate editor, and click on the unlink option, as shown below. The file attachment will be removed.

Unlinking the file
title: Attach a File to a Problem Statement
